analysis: Covered topics: stoichiometry, limiting reagent, molarity, acid-base titration calculations, significant figures, uncertainty propagation. Skills practiced: balancing equations, unit conversion, dilution calculations, endpoint identification from indicators, graph reading. Frequency: stoichiometry high (worksheet_1, worksheet_2), titration high (lab_notes, quiz_review), uncertainty medium (lab_report_template), gas laws low (single problem set). Missing areas: electrochemistry, thermochemistry, kinetics.
reference_sheet:
CHEM LAB QUICK MAP
Stoich: mol ratios from balanced eqn; always convert mass->mol first.
Molarity M=n/V(L). Dilution: M1V1=M2V2.
Limiting reagent: calc product from each reactant; lowest wins.
%yield=(actual/theoretical)*100.
Sig figs: mult/div -> fewest SF, add/sub -> fewest decimal places.
Uncertainty (independent): sqrt(sum of squares).
Titration: at equivalence n(acid)=n(base) adjusted by coefficients.
Strong acid/base pH: pH=-log[H+], pOH=-log[OH-], pH+pOH=14.
Weak acid shortcut if x<<C: [H+]~sqrt(Ka*C).
TRAPS: forgetting liters, using unbalanced eqn, rounding too early, mixing endpoint vs equivalence.
FAST PATTERN: annotate given units, write target unit, chain factors left->right.
MINI EX: 25.0 mL HCl neutralized by 30.0 mL 0.100 M NaOH (1:1) => n NaOH=0.00300 mol => M HCl=0.00300/0.0250=0.120 M.
CHECKLIST: units, SF, reasonableness, sign/direction, final boxed answer.

analysis: Covered topics: chromatography, powder/flame tests, fiber ID, blood spatter basics, glass density, qualitative ion tests. Skills practiced: evidence comparison, elimination, flowchart-based unknown ID, interpretation of band patterns. Frequency: chromatography high, ion tests high, fiber medium, blood spatter low. Missing areas: DNA profiling concepts, entomology, toxicology.
reference_sheet:
FORENSICS SNAP SHEET
Chromatography Rf=(distance solute)/(distance solvent front). Same plate/solvent only.
Powder tests: color/texture clues not definitive alone.
Flame test colors: Li crimson, Na yellow, K lilac, Cu blue-green, Sr red.
Ion quick tests: Cl- + AgNO3 -> white ppt; sulfate + Ba2+ -> white ppt; carbonate + acid -> CO2 fizz.
Fiber ID: natural fibers irregular; synthetics smoother/uniform under scope.
Glass density compare via sink-float liquids; match refractive index patterns when given.
Blood spatter basics: angle = asin(width/length) from ellipse.
TRAPS: confirmation bias, single-test conclusion, contamination.
FAST PATTERN: run non-destructive tests first; branch by most discriminating result.
MINI EX: spot 2.4 cm, front 6.0 cm -> Rf=0.40.
CHECKLIST: chain of custody, controls, duplicates, uncertainty statement, final claim + confidence.
